channel.title: NASA on 无关紧要的宇宙
channel.description: Recent content in NASA on 无关紧要的宇宙

item.title: NASA’s Largest Satellite Antenna Ever Has Just Unfurled in Space
item.description: NISAR, a giant orbiting antenna 39 feet in diameter, will monitor changes to glaciers, forests, and the Earth’s crust, providing data to help improve infrastructure and disaster responses.

item.title: NASA’s Largest Satellite Antenna Ever Has Just Unfurled in Space
item.description: NISAR, a giant orbiting antenna 39 feet in diameter, will monitor changes to glaciers, forests, and the Earth’s crust, providing data to help improve infrastructure and disaster responses.

item.title: With Starship, SpaceX encounters an obstacle that haunted NASA’s space shuttles
item.description: “We wish we were young again and NASA was this vivacious, you know?”

item.title: SpaceX’s latest Dragon mission will breathe more fire at the space station
item.description: “The boost kit will help sustain the orbiting lab’s altitude, starting in September.”

item.title: IBM and NASA Develop a Digital Twin of the Sun to Predict Future Solar Storms
item.description: The tool models the sun using AI, and its developers say it can anticipate solar flares 16 percent more accurately and in half the time of current prediction systems.

item.title: IBM and NASA Develop a Digital Twin of the Sun to Predict Future Solar Storms
item.description: The tool models the sun using AI, and its developers say it can anticipate solar flares 16 percent more accurately and in half the time of current prediction systems.

item.title: Time is running out for SpaceX to make a splash with second-gen Starship
item.description: SpaceX is gearing up for another Starship launch after three straight disappointing test flights.

item.title: The Destruction of NASA Would Be a Blow to Our Collective Imagination
item.description: As NASA grapples with major proposed budget cuts and losing some of its most brilliant minds, America’s willingness to look outward is also at risk.

item.title: The Destruction of NASA Would Be a Blow to Our Collective Imagination
item.description: As NASA grapples with major proposed budget cuts and losing some of its most brilliant minds, America’s willingness to look outward is also at risk.

item.title: WIRED Roundup: Why GPT-5 Flopped
item.description: On this episode of Uncanny Valley, we dig into WIRED’s latest—from crude deportation memes to GPT-5’s negative reception.

item.title: WIRED Roundup: Why GPT-5 Flopped
item.description: On this episode of Uncanny Valley, we dig into WIRED’s latest—from crude deportation memes to GPT-5’s negative reception.

item.title: After recent tests, China appears likely to beat the United States back to the Moon
item.description: An expert explains why this will be enormously bad for the United States.

item.title: NASA’s acting chief calls for the end of Earth science at the space agency
item.description: NASA’s charter clearly states the agency should study planet Earth, however.

item.title: Rocket Report: Ariane 6 beats Vulcan to third launch; China’s first drone ship
item.description: Why is China’s heavy-lift Long March 5B able to launch only 10 Guowang satellites at a time?

item.title: James Lovell, the steady astronaut who brought Apollo 13 home safely, has died
item.description: Lovell was the first person to fly to the Moon twice.

item.title: Why the US Is Racing to Build a Nuclear Reactor on the Moon
item.description: NASA has set a 2030 deadline to build a 100-kilowatt nuclear reactor on the moon. It’s an ambitious but potentially achievable goal that could transform space exploration, experts tell WIRED.

item.title: Why the US Is Racing to Build a Nuclear Reactor on the Moon
item.description: NASA has set a 2030 deadline to build a 100-kilowatt nuclear reactor on the moon. It’s an ambitious but potentially achievable goal that could transform space exploration, experts tell WIRED.

item.title: NASA’s new chief has radically rewritten the rules for private space stations
item.description: “Certain players are going to have to do a harder pivot.”

item.title: Houston, you’ve got a space shuttle… only NASA won’t say which one
item.description: “The acting administrator has made an identification.”

item.title: Is the Dream Chaser space plane ever going to launch into orbit?
item.description: “We will be ready for them when they’re ready to fly.”

item.title: With Trump’s cutbacks, crew heads for ISS unsure of when they’ll come back
item.description: “We are looking at the potential to extend this current flight, Crew-11.”

item.title: At $250 million, top AI salaries dwarf those of the Manhattan Project and the Space Race
item.description: A 24 year-old AI researcher will earn 327x what Oppenheimer made while developing the atomic bomb.

item.title: The curious case of Russia’s charm offensive with NASA this week
item.description: “We’re going to continue to work on the problems that we have here.”

item.title: India safely launches a $1.5 billion satellite for NASA
item.description: “We are at the threshold of fulfilling the immense scientific potential NASA and ISRO envisioned.”

item.title: A Secretive US Space Plane Will Soon Test Quantum Navigation Technology
item.description: The space plane’s test flight will advance development of a new navigation technology based on electromagnetic wave interference.

item.title: A Secretive US Space Plane Will Soon Test Quantum Navigation Technology
item.description: The space plane’s test flight will advance development of a new navigation technology based on electromagnetic wave interference.

item.title: Lawmakers writing NASA’s budget want a cheaper upper stage for the SLS rocket
item.description: Eliminating the Block 1B upgrade now would save NASA at least $500 million per year.

item.title: SpaceX launches a pair of NASA satellites to probe the origins of space weather
item.description: “This is going to really help us understand how to predict space weather in the magnetosphere.”

item.title: South Korea Plans to Build a Base on the Moon
item.description: The country’s newly formed space agency wants to establish a lunar base by 2045.

item.title: South Korea Plans to Build a Base on the Moon
item.description: The country’s newly formed space agency wants to establish a lunar base by 2045.

item.title: A Top NASA Official Is Among Thousands of Staff Leaving the Agency
item.description: Makenzie Lystrup’s departure from NASA’s Goddard Space Flight Center comes soon after the resignation of the director of JPL.

item.title: A Top NASA Official Is Among Thousands of Staff Leaving the Agency
item.description: Makenzie Lystrup’s departure from NASA’s Goddard Space Flight Center comes soon after the resignation of the director of JPL.

item.title: Trump wants to “eliminate or expedite” environmental rules for rocket launches
item.description: SpaceX, other commercial launch firms, have been seeking this change in policy.

item.title: Newly Discovered ‘Infinity Galaxy’ Could Prove How Ancient Supermassive Black Holes Formed
item.description: This collision of two galaxies could demonstrate that theorized “direct collapse black holes” exist.

item.title: Newly Discovered ‘Infinity Galaxy’ Could Prove How Ancient Supermassive Black Holes Formed
item.description: This collision of two galaxies could demonstrate that theorized “direct collapse black holes” exist.

item.title: Nearly 3,000 people are leaving NASA, and this director is one of them
item.description: Makenzie Lystrup’s departure from Goddard comes soon after the resignation of the director of JPL.

item.title: As White House talks about impounding NASA funding, Congress takes the threat seriously
item.description: “NASA appears to be acting in accordance with a fringe, extremist ideology.”

item.title: After a partly successful test flight, European firm eyes space station mission
item.description: “One year ago, this was out of the discussion.”

item.title: The ISS is nearing retirement, so why is NASA still gung-ho about Starliner?
item.description: NASA is doing all it can to ensure Boeing doesn’t abandon the Starliner program.

item.title: Congress moves to reject bulk of White House’s proposed NASA cuts
item.description: We’re still months away from these budget bills having a chance to become law.

item.title: We saw the heart of Pluto 10 years ago—it’ll be a long wait to see the rest
item.description: A 50-year wait for a second mission wouldn’t be surprising. Just ask Uranus and Neptune.

item.title: Everything We Know About the Interstellar Object 3I/ATLAS
item.description: A team of astronomers recently discovered the traveling space object, just the third of its kind to pass through our solar system.

item.title: Everything We Know About the Interstellar Object 3I/ATLAS
item.description: A team of astronomers recently discovered the traveling space object, just the third of its kind to pass through our solar system.

item.title: “It’s a heist”: Senator calls out Texas for trying to steal shuttle from Smithsonian
item.description: “The title of this amendment is ‘Houston, We Have a Problem.’”
